$comment: Copy of the upstream schema without the additionalProperties: false. This is needed so we can provide extra linter settings without waiting for the schema to catch up.

linters.$comment: anyOf with enum is used to allow auto completion of non-custom linters

exclude.description:
List of regular expressions of issue texts to exclude.
But independently from this option we use default exclude patterns. Their usage can be controlled through `exclude-use-default`.

exclude-case-sensitive.description: If set to true, exclude and exclude-rules regular expressions become case sensitive.

exclude-dirs.description: Which directories to exclude: issues from them won't be reported.

items.description:
You can use regexp here. The regexp is applied on the full path.
"/" will be replaced by current OS file path separator to properly work on Windows.

exclude-files.description: Which files to exclude: they will be analyzed, but issues from them will not be reported.

items.description:
You can use regexp here. There is no need to include all autogenerated files, we confidently recognize them. If that is not the case, please let us know.
"/" will be replaced by current OS file path separator to properly work on Windows.

exclude-generated-strict.description: To follow strict Go generated file convention

exclude-rules.description: Exclude configuration per-path, per-linter, per-text and per-source

exclude-use-default.description: Independently from option `exclude` we use default exclude patterns. This behavior can be disabled by this option.

fix.description: Fix found issues (if it's supported by the linter).

include.description: The list of ids of default excludes to include or disable.

max-issues-per-linter.description: Maximum issues count per one linter. Set to 0 to disable.

max-same-issues.description: Maximum count of issues with the same text. Set to 0 to disable.

new.description: Show only new issues: if there are unstaged changes or untracked files, only those changes are analyzed, else only changes in HEAD~ are analyzed.

new-from-patch.description: Show only new issues created in git patch with this file path.

new-from-rev.description: Show only new issues created after this git revision.

whole-files.description: Show issues in any part of update files (requires new-from-rev or new-from-patch).

disable-all.description: Whether to disable all linters. You can re-enable them with `enable` explicitly.

enable-all.description: Whether to enable all linters. You can re-disable them with `disable` explicitly.

presets.description: Allow to use different presets of linters

linters-settings.description: All available settings of specific linters.

exclude.description: To specify a set of function names to exclude.

use-builtin-exclusions.description: To enable/disable the asasalint builtin exclusions of function names.

custom.description:
The custom section can be used to define linter plugins to be loaded at runtime. See README of golangci-lint for more information.
Each custom linter should have a unique name.

description.description: The description of the linter, for documentation purposes only.

original-url.description: Intended to point to the repo location of the linter, for documentation purposes only.

path.description: The path to the plugin *.so. Can be absolute or local.

settings.description: Plugins settings/configuration. Only work with plugin based on `linterdb.PluginConstructor`.

max-complexity.description: Max complexity the function can have

skip-tests.description: Should the linter execute on test files as well

disable-const-dec-num-check.description: Const declarations will be ignored for dec num check

disable-dec-num-check.description: Multiple global type, const and var declarations are allowed

disable-dec-order-check.description: Order of declarations is not checked

disable-init-func-first-check.description: Allow init func to be anywhere in file

disable-type-dec-num-check.description: Type declarations will be ignored for dec num check

disable-var-dec-num-check.description: Var declarations will be ignored for dec num check

ignore-underscore-vars.description: Underscore vars (vars with "_" as the name) will be ignored at all checks

deny.description: Packages that are not allowed where the value is a suggestion.

files.description: List of file globs that will match this list of settings to compare against.

list-mode.description: Used to determine the package matching priority.

max-blank-identifiers.description: Check assignments with too many blank identifiers.

keywords.description: Keywords for detecting duplicate words. If this list is not empty, only the words defined in this list will be detected.

check-blank.description: Report about assignment of errors to blank identifier

check-type-assertions.description: Report about not checking errors in type assertions, i.e.: `a := b.(MyStruct)`

disable-default-exclusions.description: To disable the errcheck built-in exclude list

exclude.description: DEPRECATED: use `exclude-functions` instead. Path to a file containing a list of functions to exclude from checking.

exclude-functions.description: List of functions to exclude from checking, where each entry is a single function to exclude

ignore.description: DEPRECATED: use `exclude-functions` instead. Comma-separated list of pairs of the form "pkg:regex".

report-no-exported.description: Issue on struct that doesn't have exported fields.

asserts.description: Check for plain type assertions and type switches.

errorf.description: Check whether fmt.Errorf uses the %w verb for formatting errors

errorf-multi.description: Permit more than 1 %w verb, valid per Go 1.20

check.description: Program elements to check for exhaustiveness.

check-generated.description: Check switch statements in generated files

default-case-required.description: Switch statement requires default case even if exhaustive.

default-signifies-exhaustive.description: Presence of `default` case in switch statements satisfies exhaustiveness, even if all enum members are not listed.

explicit-exhaustive-map.description: Only run exhaustive check on map literals with "//exhaustive:enforce" comment.

explicit-exhaustive-switch.description: Only run exhaustive check on switches with "//exhaustive:enforce" comment.

ignore-enum-members.description: Enum members matching `regex` do not have to be listed in switch statements to satisfy exhaustiveness

ignore-enum-types.description: Enum types matching the supplied regex do not have to be listed in switch statements to satisfy exhaustiveness.

package-scope-only.description: Consider enums only in package scopes, not in inner scopes.

exclude.description: List of regular expressions to exclude struct packages and names from check.

include.description: List of regular expressions to match struct packages and names.

analyze-types.description: Instead of matching the literal source code, use type information to replace expressions with strings that contain the package name and (for methods and fields) the type name.

forbid.description: List of identifiers to forbid (written using `regexp`)

forbid-focus-container.description: Trigger warning for ginkgo focus containers like FDescribe, FContext, FWhen or FIt.

forbid-spec-pollution.description: Trigger a warning for variable assignments in ginkgo containers like `Describe`, `Context` and `When`, instead of in `BeforeEach()`.

suppress-async-assertion.description: Suppress the function all in async assertion warning.

suppress-compare-assertion.description: Suppress the wrong comparison assertion warning.

suppress-err-assertion.description: Suppress the wrong error assertion warning.

suppress-len-assertion.description: Suppress the wrong length assertion warning.

suppress-nil-assertion.description: Suppress the wrong nil assertion warning.

suppress-type-compare-assertion.description: Suppress warning for comparing values from different types, like int32 and uint32.

validate-async-intervals.description: Best effort validation of async intervals (timeout and polling).

min-complexity.description: Minimal code complexity to report (we recommend 10-20).

ignore-calls.description: Ignore when constant is not used as function argument

ignore-strings.description: Exclude strings matching the given regular expression

match-constant.description: Look for existing constants matching the values

disabled-tags.description: Disable multiple checks by tags, run `GL_DEBUG=gocritic golangci-lint run` to see all tags and checks.

enabled-checks.description: Which checks should be enabled. By default, a list of stable checks is used. To see it, run `GL_DEBUG=gocritic golangci-lint run`.

enabled-tags.description: Enable multiple checks by tags, run `GL_DEBUG=gocritic golangci-lint run` to see all tags and checks.

settings.description: Settings passed to gocritic. Properties must be valid and enabled check names.

min-complexity.description: Minimum code complexity to report (we recommend 10-20).

capital.description: Check that each sentence starts with a capital letter.

check-all.description: DEPRECATED: Check all top-level comments, not only declarations.

exclude.description: List of regexps for excluding particular comment lines from check.

period.description: Check that each sentence ends with a period.

keywords.description: Report any comments starting with one of these keywords. This is useful for TODO or FIXME comments that might be left in the code accidentally and should be resolved before merging.

rewrite-rules.description: Apply the rewrite rules to the source before reformatting.

extra-rules.description: Choose whether or not to use the extra rules that are disabled by default.

lang-version.description: Select the Go version to target.

module-path.description: Module path which contains the source code being formatted.

template.description: Template to put on top of every file.
examples:
{{ MY COMPANY }}
SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0

Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
You may obtain a copy of the License at:

    http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
limitations under the License.

template-path.description: Path to the file containing the template source.

const.description: Constants to use in the template.

regexp.description: Regular expressions to use in your template.

local-prefixes.description: Put imports beginning with prefix after 3rd-party packages. It is a comma-separated list of prefixes.

checks.description: The list of enabled checks, see https://github.com/tommy-muehle/go-mnd/#checks for description.

ignored-files.description: List of file patterns to exclude from analysis.

ignored-functions.description: Comma-separated list of function patterns to exclude from the analysis.

ignored-numbers.description: List of numbers to exclude from analysis.

exclude-forbidden.description: Forbid the use of the `exclude` directives.

retract-allow-no-explanation.description: Allow to not explain why the version has been retracted in the `retract` directives.

local_replace_directives.description: Raise lint issues if loading local path with replace directive

reason.description: Reason why the recommended module should be used.

recommendations.description: Recommended modules that should be used instead.

versions.description: List of blocked module version constraints.

reason.description: Reason why the version constraint exists.

confidence.description: Filter out the issues with a lower confidence than the given value

config.description: To specify the configuration of rules

excludes.description: To specify a set of rules to explicitly exclude

includes.description: To select a subset of rules to run

severity.description: Filter out the issues with a lower severity than the given value

escape-hatches.description: List of fully qualified names in the `full/pkg/path.name` form, to act as "i18n escape hatches".

watch-for-scripts.description: List of Unicode scripts to watch for any usage in string literals.

settings.description:
Settings per analyzer. Map of analyzer name to specific settings.
Run `go tool vet help` to find out more.

^.*$.description: Run `go tool vet help <analyzer>` to see all settings.

no-unaliased.description: Do not allow unaliased imports of aliased packages.

skip-single-param.description: Skips check for interface methods with only a single parameter.

max.description: The maximum number of methods allowed for an interface.

ireturn.description: Use either `reject` or `allow` properties for interfaces matching.

line-length.description: Maximum allowed line length, lines longer will be reported.

kitlog.description: Allow check for the github.com/go-kit/log library.

klog.description: Allow check for the k8s.io/klog/v2 library.

logr.description: Allow check for the github.com/go-logr/logr library.

no-printf-like.description: Require printf-like format specifier (%s, %d for example) not present.

require-string-key.description: Require all logging keys to be inlined constant strings.

rules.description: List of custom rules to check against, where each rule is a single logger pattern, useful for wrapped loggers.

zap.description: Allow check for the "sugar logger" from go.uber.org/zap library.

always.description: Allow only slices initialized with a length of zero.

misspell.description: Correct spellings using locale preferences for US or UK. Default is to use a neutral variety of English.

max-func-lines.description: Report if a function has more lines of code than this value and it has naked returns.

min-complexity.description: Minimum complexity of "if" statements to report.

checked-types.description: Order of return types to check.

block-size.description: set block size that is still ok

allow-no-explanation.description: Exclude these linters from requiring an explanation.

allow-unused.description: Enable to ensure that nolint directives are all used.

require-explanation.description: Enable to require an explanation of nonzero length after each nolint directive.

require-specific.description: Enable to require nolint directives to mention the specific linter being suppressed.

report-error-in-defer.description: Report named error if it is assigned inside defer.

ignore-missing.description: Ignore missing calls to `t.Parallel()` and only report incorrect uses of it.

ignore-missing-subtests.description: Ignore missing calls to `t.Parallel()` in subtests. Top-level tests are still required to have `t.Parallel`, but subtests are allowed to skip it.

err-error.description: Optimizes into `err.Error()` even if it is only equivalent for non-nil errors.

int-conversion.description: Optimizes even if it requires an int or uint type cast.

prealloc.description:
We do not recommend using this linter before doing performance profiling.
For most programs usage of `prealloc` will be premature optimization.

for-loops.description: Report preallocation suggestions on for loops.

range-loops.description: Report preallocation suggestions on range loops.

simple.description: Report preallocation suggestions only on simple loops that have no returns/breaks/continues/gotos in them.

ignore.description: Comma-separated list of predeclared identifiers to not report on.

q.description: Include method names and field names (i.e., qualified names) in checks.

replace-first-arg-in-append.description: Skip first argument of append function.

skip-any-generated.description: Skip any generated files from the checking.

args-on-sep-lines.description: Enforce putting arguments on separate lines.

attr-only.description: Enforce using attributes only (incompatible with kv-only).

context-only.description: Enforce using methods that accept a context.

key-naming-case.description: Enforce a single key naming convention.

kv-only.description: Enforce using key-value pairs only (incompatible with attr-only).

no-mixed-args.description: Enforce not mixing key-value pairs and attributes.

no-raw-keys.description: Enforce using constants instead of raw keys.

static-msg.description: Enforce using static values for log messages.

ignore-check-signatures.description: A list of regexes for function signatures that silence `record-error` and `set-status` reports if found in the call path to a returned error.

dot-import-whitelist.description: By default, ST1001 forbids all uses of dot imports in non-test packages. This setting allows setting a whitelist of import paths that can be dot-imported anywhere.

http-status-code-whitelist.description: ST1013 recommends using constants from the net/http package instead of hard-coding numeric HTTP status codes. This setting specifies a list of numeric status codes that this check does not complain about.

initialisms.description: ST1003 check, among other things, for the correct capitalization of initialisms. The set of known initialisms can be configured with this option.

align.description: Align and sort can be used together or separately.

order.description: Specify the order of tags, the other tags will be sorted by name.

use-field-name.description: Use the struct field name to check the name of the struct tag.

all.description: The option `all` will run against whole test files (`_test.go`) regardless of method/function signatures.

mode.description: To require or remove extra Assert() call?

allow-packages.description: List of packages that don't end with _test that tests are allowed to be in.

skip-regexp.description: Files with names matching this regular expression are skipped.

first.description: Check if *testing.B is first param of helper function.

name.description: Check if *testing.B param has b name.

first.description: Check if *testing.F is first param of helper function.

name.description: Check if *testing.F param has f name.

first.description: Check if *testing.TB is first param of helper function.

name.description: Check if *testing.TB param has tb name.

first.description: Check if *testing.T is first param of helper function.

name.description: Check if *testing.T param has t name.

check-exported.description:
Inspect exported functions. Set to true if no external program/library imports your code.

WARNING: if you enable this setting, unparam will report a lot of false-positives in text editors:
if it's called for subdir of a project it can't find external interfaces. All text editor integrations
with golangci-lint call it on a directory with the changed file.

ignore-chan-recv-ok.description: Ignore `ok` variables that hold the bool return value of a channel receive.

ignore-decls.description: Optional list of variable declarations that should be ignored completely.

ignore-map-index-ok.description: Ignore `ok` variables that hold the bool return value of a map index.

ignore-names.description: Optional list of variable names that should be ignored completely.

ignore-type-assert-ok.description: Ignore `ok` variables that hold the bool return value of a type assertion

max-distance.description: Variables used in at most this N-many lines will be ignored.

min-name-length.description: The minimum length of a variable's name that is considered `long`.

multi-func.description: Enforces newlines (or comments) after every multi-line function signature

multi-if.description: Enforces newlines (or comments) after every multi-line if statement

ignoreInterfaceRegexps.description: An array of glob patterns which, if matched to an underlying interface name, will ignore unwrapped errors returned from a function whose call is defined on the given interface.

ignorePackageGlobs.description: An array of glob patterns which, if any match the package of the function returning the error, will skip wrapcheck analysis for this error.

ignoreSigRegexps.description: An array of strings which specify regular expressions of signatures to ignore.

ignoreSigs.description: An array of strings which specify substrings of signatures to ignore.

allow-assign-and-anything.description: Controls if you may cuddle assignments and anything without needing an empty line between them.

allow-assign-and-call.description: Allow calls and assignments to be cuddled as long as the lines have any matching variables, fields or types.

allow-cuddle-with-calls.description: A list of call idents that everything can be cuddled with.

allow-cuddle-with-rhs.description: AllowCuddleWithRHS is a list of right hand side variables that is allowed to be cuddled with anything.

allow-multiline-assign.description: Allow multiline assignments to be cuddled.

allow-separated-leading-comment.description: Allow leading comments to be separated with empty lines.

allow-trailing-comment.description: Allow trailing comments in ending of blocks.

error-variable-names.description: When force-err-cuddling is enabled this is a list of names used for error variables to check for in the conditional.

force-case-trailing-whitespace.description: Force newlines in end of case at this limit (0 = never).

force-err-cuddling.description: Causes an error when an If statement that checks an error variable doesn't cuddle with the assignment of that variable.

force-short-decl-cuddling.description: Causes an error if a short declaration (:=) cuddles with anything other than another short declaration.

strict-append.description: If true, append is only allowed to be cuddled if appending value is matching variables, fields or types on line above.

path-prefix.description: Add a prefix to the output file references.

print-issued-lines.description: Print lines of code with issue.

print-linter-name.description: Print linter name in the end of issue text.

sort-results.description: Sort results by: filepath, line and column.

uniq-by-line.description: Make issues output unique by line.

allow-parallel-runners.description: Allow multiple parallel golangci-lint instances running. If disabled, golangci-lint acquires file lock on start.

allow-serial-runners.description: Allow multiple golangci-lint instances running, but serialize them around a lock.

build-tags.description: List of build tags to pass to all linters.

concurrency.description: Number of concurrent runners. Defaults to the number of available CPU cores.

issues-exit-code.description: Exit code when at least one issue was found.

modules-download-mode.description:
Option to pass to "go list -mod={option}".
See "go help modules" for more information.

case-sensitive.description: If set to true, severity-rules regular expressions become case sensitive.

default-severity.description: Set the default severity for issues. If severity rules are defined and the issues do not match or no severity is provided to the rule this will be the default severity applied. Severities should match the supported severity names of the selected out format.

rules.description:
When a list of severity rules are provided, severity information will be added to lint issues. Severity rules have the same filtering capability as exclude rules except you are allowed to specify one matcher per severity rule.
Only affects out formats that support setting severity information.
